00024 // Function: TextContentAssistWidget()
00025 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00026 TextContentAssistWidget::TextContentAssistWidget(QPlainTextEdit* parent,
00027                                                  QSharedPointer<ITextContentMatcher> matcher) :
00028     QListWidget(parent), maxVisibleItems_(DEFAULT_MAX_VISIBLE_ITEMS),
00029     lastAssistStartPos_(-1), contentFound_(false)
00030 {
00031     Q_ASSERT(parent != 0);
00032     Q_ASSERT(matcher != 0);
00033     parent_ = parent;
00034     matcher_ = matcher;
00035 
00036     // Set widget settings.
00037     setWindowFlags(Qt::Tool | Qt::FramelessWindowHint | Qt::WindowStaysOnTopHint | Qt::X11BypassWindowManagerHint);
00038     setFrameShadow(QFrame::Raised);
00039     setFocusPolicy(Qt::NoFocus);
00040     setFont(QFont("Tahoma", 10));
00041 
00042     // We want the widget to look active even though it is inactive.
00043     QPalette pal = palette();
00044     pal.setColor(QPalette::Inactive, QPalette::Highlight, Qt::darkBlue);
00045     pal.setColor(QPalette::Inactive, QPalette::HighlightedText, Qt::white);
00046     setPalette(pal);
00047 }

00056 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00057 // Function: handleKey()
00058 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 bool TextContentAssistWidget::tryHandleKey(QKeyEvent* e)
00060 {
00061     QString text = parent_->toPlainText().left(parent_->textCursor().position()) + e->text();
00062 
00063     // Check if we can commit.
00064     if (contentFound_ && (e->key() == Qt::Key_Return || e->key() == Qt::Key_Tab ||
00065                            (canCommitWith(e) && !matcher_->lookForwardMatch(text))))
00066     {
00067         // Commit the selection.
00068         commitSelection();
00069 
00070         // If the key is a character, let the editor handle it too.
00071         if (e->key() != Qt::Key_Return && e->key() != Qt::Key_Tab)
00072         {
00073             return false;
00074         }
00075 
00076         // Otherwise we're fully done with it.
00077         return true;
00078     }
00079 
00080     // Handle up and down arrows and escape, if the content is shown.
00081     if (isContentShown())
00082     {
00083         switch (e->key())
00084         {
00085         case Qt::Key_Up:
00086         case Qt::Key_Down:
00087             {
00088                 if (isVisible())
00089                 {
00090                     keyPressEvent(e);
00091                     return true;
00092                 }
00093                 break;
00094             }
00095 
00096         case Qt::Key_Left:
00097         case Qt::Key_Right:
00098         case Qt::Key_Home:
00099         case Qt::Key_End:
00100             {
00101                 cancel();
00102                 return false;
00103             }
00104 
00105         case Qt::Key_A:
00106             {
00107                 if (e->modifiers() == Qt::ControlModifier)
00108                 {
00109                     cancel();
00110                     return false;
00111                 }
00112                 break;
00113             }
00114 
00115         case Qt::Key_Escape:
00116             {
00117                 cancel();
00118                 return true;
00119             }
00120         }
00121     }
00122 
00123     return false;
00124 }

00126 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00127 // Function: updateContent()
00128 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00129 void TextContentAssistWidget::updateAssist(QKeyEvent* e)
00130 {
00131     // Invoke the content assist for certain keys.
00132     if (e->text().contains(QRegExp("^[a-z|A-z|0-9|_|;|Ä|ä|Ö|ö|Å|å|(|)|,|&]$")) ||
00133         e->key() == Qt::Key_Backspace || e->key() == Qt::Key_Return ||
00134         (contentFound_ && (e->key() == Qt::Key_Down || e->key() == Qt::Key_Up || e->text().contains(' '))))
00135     {
00136         updateMatches();
00137     }
00138     // Cancel assisting if needed.
00139     else if (e->modifiers() == Qt::NoModifier)
00140     {
00141         hideAssist();
00142     }
00143 }

00145 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00146 // Function: cancel()
00147 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 void TextContentAssistWidget::cancel()
00149 {
00150     toolTipHintWidget_.hide();
00151     hideAssist();
00152 }

00157 void TextContentAssistWidget::setMaxVisibleItems(int count)
00158 {
00159     Q_ASSERT(count > 0);
00160     maxVisibleItems_ = count;
00161 }

00163 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00164 // Function: isContentShown()
00165 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00166 bool TextContentAssistWidget::isContentShown() const
00167 {
00168     return (isVisible() || toolTipHintWidget_.isVisible());
00169 }

00185

00187     commitSelection();
00188 }

00190 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 // Function: updateMatches()
00192 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193 void TextContentAssistWidget::updateMatches()
00194 {
00195     // Clear the content assist and fill it with new content.
00196     clear();
00197 
00198     QString toolTipText;
00199     int toolTipIndex = -1;
00200     QString text = parent_->toPlainText().left(parent_->textCursor().position());
00201 
00202     contentFound_ = matcher_->fillWithContent(text, *this, lastAssistStartPos_, toolTipText,
00203                                                 toolTipIndex);
00204 
00205     // Show the tool tip if there was some content for it.
00206     if (toolTipIndex > 0)
00207     {
00208         showToolTipHint(toolTipText, toolTipIndex);
00209     }
00210     else
00211     {
00212         toolTipHintWidget_.hide();
00213     }
00214     
00215     // Check if content was found.
00216     if (contentFound_)
00217     {
00218         // Fit the widget to the contents and move it accordingly.
00219         fitToContents();
00220         moveCloseToCursor(lastAssistStartPos_);
00221 
00222         setCurrentRow(0);
00223         show();
00224     }
00225     else
00226     {
00227         hide();
00228     }
00229 }
00230 
00231 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00232 // Function: moveCloseToCursor()
00233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 void TextContentAssistWidget::moveCloseToCursor(int cursorPos)
00235 {
00236     // Save the old cursor.
00237     QTextCursor oldCursor = parent_->textCursor();
00238 
00239     // Move the cursor to the given position.
00240     QTextCursor cursor = oldCursor;
00241     cursor.setPosition(cursorPos, QTextCursor::MoveAnchor);
00242     parent_->setTextCursor(cursor);
00243 
00244     // Determine the correct upper-left corner position for the widget.
00245     int screenWidth = QApplication::desktop()->width();
00246     int screenHeight = QApplication::desktop()->height();
00247 
00248     // By default, the desired position is below the cursor position.
00249     QPoint pos = parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().bottomLeft()) + QPoint(-10, 10);
00250     
00251     // Restrict x coordinate by the screen width.
00252     pos.setX(std::min(std::max(0, pos.x()), screenWidth - width()));
00253 
00254     // Check if the tool tip hint is visible.
00255     if (toolTipHintWidget_.isVisible())
00256     {
00257         // Then by default, place the widget above the cursor.
00258         pos.setY(parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().topLeft()).y() - height() - 10);
00259 
00260         // Lift it up if the tool tip hint is also above the cursor.
00261         if (pos.y() > toolTipHintWidget_.pos().y() - height())
00262         {
00263             pos.setY(toolTipHintWidget_.pos().y() - height());
00264         }
00265 
00266         // If the widget goes over the top edge of the screen, move it below the tool tip hint.
00267         if (pos.y() < 0)
00268         {
00269             pos.setY(toolTipHintWidget_.pos().y() + toolTipHintWidget_.height());
00270         }
00271     }
00272     // Otherwise lift the widget above the cursor only if necessary to keep it fully in view.
00273     else if (pos.y() + height() > screenHeight)
00274     {
00275         pos.setY(parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().topLeft()).y() - height() - 10);
00276     }
00277     
00278     // Move the widget to the final position.
00279     move(pos);
00280 
00281     // Restore the old cursor.
00282     parent_->setTextCursor(oldCursor);
00283 }

00285 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00286 // Function: canCommitWith()
00287 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00288 bool TextContentAssistWidget::canCommitWith(QKeyEvent* e) const
00289 {
00290     return (!e->text().contains(QRegExp("^[a-z|A-z|0-9|_|;|Ä|ä|Ö|ö|Å|å]$")) &&
00291             e->key() != Qt::Key_Backspace && e->key() != Qt::Key_Escape &&
00292             e->key() != Qt::Key_Up && e->key() != Qt::Key_Down &&
00293             e->key() != Qt::Key_Left && e->key() != Qt::Key_Right &&
00294             e->key() != Qt::Key_Space && e->modifiers() != Qt::ControlModifier);
00295 }
00296

00298 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00299 // Function: commitSelection()
00300 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00301 void TextContentAssistWidget::commitSelection()
00302 {
00303     Q_ASSERT(lastAssistStartPos_ != -1);
00304 
00305     // Setup the text cursor for replacement.
00306     QTextCursor cursor = parent_->textCursor();
00307     cursor.setPosition(lastAssistStartPos_, QTextCursor::KeepAnchor);
00308     cursor.insertText(currentItem()->text());    
00309 
00310     hideAssist();
00311 }
00312 
00313 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00314 // Function: fitToContents()
00315 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00316 void TextContentAssistWidget::fitToContents()
00317 {
00318     if (count() == 0)
00319     {
00320         return;
00321     }
00322 
00323     int visibleRowCount = std::min(count(), maxVisibleItems_);
00324     int height = visibleRowCount * sizeHintForRow(0) + frameWidth() * 2;
00325     int width = sizeHintForColumn(0) + frameWidth() * 2 + verticalScrollBar()->sizeHint().width();
00326     
00327     setFixedSize(width, height);
00328 }
00329 
00330 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00331 // Function: showToolTipHint()
00332 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00333 void TextContentAssistWidget::showToolTipHint(QString const& text, int cursorPos)
00334 {
00335     // Set the tool tip hint text.
00336     toolTipHintWidget_.setText(text);
00337     toolTipHintWidget_.adjustSize();
00338 
00339     // Retrieve the y coordinate from the current cursor.
00340     QPoint pos;
00341     pos.setY(parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().bottomLeft()).y() + 5);
00342 
00343     // Save the old cursor.
00344     QTextCursor oldCursor = parent_->textCursor();
00345 
00346     // Move the cursor to the given position.
00347     QTextCursor cursor = oldCursor;
00348     cursor.setPosition(cursorPos, QTextCursor::MoveAnchor);
00349     parent_->setTextCursor(cursor);
00350 
00351     // Determine the correct upper-left corner position for the widget.
00352     int screenWidth = QApplication::desktop()->width();
00353     int screenHeight = QApplication::desktop()->height();
00354 
00355     // By default, the desired position is below the cursor position.
00356     pos.setX(parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().bottomLeft()).x());
00357 
00358     // Restrict x coordinate by the screen width.
00359     pos.setX(std::min(std::max(0, pos.x()), screenWidth - toolTipHintWidget_.width()));
00360 
00361     // If the widget would be partially below the screen, lift it above the cursor.
00362     if (pos.y() + toolTipHintWidget_.height() > screenHeight)
00363     {
00364         pos.setY(parent_->mapToGlobal(parent_->cursorRect().topLeft()).y() - toolTipHintWidget_.height() - 5);
00365     }
00366 
00367     // Move the widget to the final position.
00368     toolTipHintWidget_.move(pos);
00369 
00370     // Restore the old cursor.
00371     parent_->setTextCursor(oldCursor);
00372 
00373     // Show the hint.
00374     toolTipHintWidget_.show();
00375 }

00380 void TextContentAssistWidget::hideAssist()
00381 {

00384     contentFound_ = false;
